result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrique M Sharp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: PAY RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $582.00 TO COUSIN'S SUBS IN MENOMONEE FALLS DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT TO BE ENTERED.
PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND DNA SURCHARGES DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED.
NO CONTACT WITH THE COUNSIN SUB SHOP ON 1233 E. BRADY.
Court will GRANT motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrique M Sharp in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEARwith the following conditions: 
*PAY RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $582.00 TO COUNSIN'S SUBS IN MENOMONEE FALLS DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT TO BE ENTERED
*NO CONTACT WITH THE COUNSIN SUB SHOP ON 1233 E BRADY
*PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND DNA SURCHARGES DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED
*GIVE DNA SAMPLE

Court will GRANT motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Demetrique M Sharp in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

By stipualtion of the parties restitution is set in the amount of $582.82 to Counsin Sub Shop.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetrique M Sharp in court with attorney Francisco Araiza. Alyssa Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (8/1/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 09-02-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Demetrique M Sharp
Current: 2350 North 5th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 07-31-2015)
Prior: 2350 North 5th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Demetrique M Sharp in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/31/15 @ 1:30 pm
